intro: Durabaculum rennellii, commonly known as the Rennell Island durabaculum, is a rare flowering plant native to the island of Rennell in the South Pacific. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, woody stems and large, showy flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in humid, coastal environments and is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
